alert.note: Alert for Wasatch Back; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 3:58PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Wasatch...east central Salt Lake...southwestern Summit and northern Utah Counties through 430 PM MDT... At 357 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Park City, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Park City, Summit Park, Kamas, Oakley, Francis, Wanship, South Snyderville Basin, Samak, North Snyderville Basin, Big Cottonwood Canyon, Little Cottonwood Canyon, Mill Creek Canyon, Midway, Alta, Peoa, Hoytsville, Brighton, Snyderville, Kimball Junction and Marion. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Utah between mile markers 143 and 159. US Route 40 between mile markers 0 and 13. Utah Route 35 between mile markers 0 and 3. Mirror Lake Highway between mile markers 0 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Wasatch Back; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Western Uinta Mountains
